column4: has anyone else had problems getting network shares to show up in Places>Network>Workgroup?  I can't seem to get Ubuntu to connect to a NAS unless I type nautilus smb://192.168.1.1 and I've read a ton of posts, but they seem to be outdated for Ubuntu 10.10.
which one?  on the nas or my computer?
both are default and I have smbclient on the computer
so do I even need to mess with the smb.conf on the computer since I'm not using smbd on the comp?
are both running ubuntu?
no, the router is running dd-wrt and smbd under it and my computer is running ubuntu
okay, so do you know what the name of the workgroup on the router is?
my windows machines have no problem seeing it
yes, workgroup is it
any authentication required?
jleg and thats the default in smb.conf as well, right?
no, guest account and full access
okay. and yes by default it is set to use workgroup.
you may want to try specifying a couple other parameters though on top of the default configuration
when I do 'smbclient --list=192.168.1.1 --user=guest --no-pass' it sees the share but wont let me browse to it
and mapping it using nautilus smb://... is dumb b/c it wont show up in other programs as a place to save or load from
alright. try seeing if this helps. edit your smb.conf and add the line "netbios name = hostname" under global
edit smb.conf on computer or router?
the computer
also change "wins support = no" to yes
save that and then install winbind. Once that's done restart samba and cross your fingers
you may need to restart networking as well too
this is starting to sound a lot like a post I read... but will try
alright just tell me if you have any more trouble
